channel.title: 🔥 Open Data hot twitter posts | by onData
channel.description: Tweets about open data, which have received at least 10 hearts or retweets, in many languages

item.title: #en @ 1514020210734415877
item.description: Forest disturbance and subsequent recovery can be mapped with #timeseries #remotesensing. Success (or not) of return of trees can be quantified, aid in targeting tree planting activities. #Landsat #ForestRecovery #OpenData: https://t.co/XkRiRx1pop Science: https://t.co/XpO3uupVKX https://t.co/GTW7V9U3Wm

item.title: #en @ 1514014736580415491
item.description: Our paper on our "Covid Open Data" repo (https://t.co/XwpxmQ9kdD) is finally available in Nature Scientific Data https://t.co/IHhTDE4SGO. Just in time for the N'th wave of the virus to hit USA :(

item.title: #es @ 1513993952814370825
item.description:
En el Perú: Las cifras de pacientes hospitalizados por #COVID19 en su punto más bajo tras DOS años.
Ninguna región con punto de quiebre al alza.
La actual ocupación, a nivel nacional, es del 13% sobre el total de camas instaladas.
Fuente: #DatosAbiertos SUSALUD al 11/04 https://t.co/8343aSdwLF

item.title: #en @ 1513983997164068875
item.description:
🚨ICYMI🚨 Bike and scooter trips are back! Austin recorded their highest trips per day since fall of 2019.
Visit their Open Data Portal to see average trip times, distances, and locations by mode and by quarter: ➡️https://t.co/oYEGv0ixvw https://t.co/Ct7DcIjRD4

item.title: #en @ 1513957811264409612
item.description: Excellent piece on the lack of transparency/open data from the English courts. And really pleasing to see the work we did with @JoePTomlinson to quantify the limited availability of judicial review judgments cited as evidence in support of this article’s central thesis. https://t.co/74LB9XPMnm

item.title: #en @ 1513843021359501315
item.description:
We elaborated a #flood fatalities database for the Euro-Mediterranean region. It provides data on fatalities’ gender, age, location, and circumstances of death. The database covers small and large scale events
#OpenData @ScientificData @Nature https://t.co/Ur2iNTJTTn https://t.co/WM84e8yllo

item.title: #en @ 1513837767557619713
item.description:
Data as a Service is an approach to governments stewarding & providing sustainable, equitable access to data.
In our latest @PublicDigitalHQ blog post, @JeniT explores how cities can go beyond a portal-only (#opendata) strategy & implement this approach. https://t.co/g1rp7m8M29

item.title: #en @ 1513799897979498503
item.description: Extremely relevant comment in Nature Ecol. & Evo. about how open data can deepen science inequalities between those collecting the data on tropical forests and those publishing it. Essential reading with 8 suggestions on how to make #OpenData fair. https://t.co/1UuI6Pgvah

item.title: #en @ 1513550423487139848
item.description:
Open data means that hard-won output is transferred to more privileged individuals and institutions.
Power flows from the originators to public agencies, private companies and data scientists, mainly in the global North.

item.title: #en @ 1513550421033472002
item.description:
The status quo is shocking. (1) Richest countries have the least tropical forest, but most scientists and economic power. (2) Measuring and Monitoring is skilled, tough work. (3) It often relies on poorly-funded, precarious employment.
Few who demand "open data" recognise this. https://t.co/nvCqbraa9e

item.description: Hae was, gerade These gehoert: Die Einfuehrung der E-Akte ist _notwendige_ Voraussetzung fuer die automatisierte Bereitstellung von Open Data?! Also ich verstehe den Gedanken, aber das ist schon ein wenig… kurz gedacht?

item.title: #en @ 1513445132153995268
item.description:
Open data as a ‘digital public good’ has a variety of uses — from improving urban mobility to protecting biodiversity.
Yet, only 8% of datasets essential for innovation are #OpenData 📊

item.title: #en @ 1513433012629049346
item.description: @deluisa_maybe @TimStrutzi @dominicstucki @Lenny_du_Nord @_wrzlbrnft_ And also - thinking further. The Swiss public transport system is often held up in Germany as an example to emulate. But many in the rail industry in Germany are *against* mandated open data... Do they even know what Switzerland does?

item.title: #fi @ 1513431919010193410
item.description:
Osa suomalaisista ja #Suomi🇫🇮-päättäjistä uskoo yhä vastoin kansainvälisen tieteen tutkimustuloksia, että koronan saaminen on turvallista lähes kaikille.
#VakuutusLaitos #OP, ei kuitenkaan perusta päätöksiään kansallismutuun, vaan kansainväliseen tutkittuun dataan. #OpenData🌍 https://t.co/FRJ8EO4C78

item.title: #en @ 1513431790752567298
item.description: @jonworth @TimStrutzi @dominicstucki @Lenny_du_Nord @_wrzlbrnft_ One of the few examples of good Data Governance in the transit sector… All public transit concessionaires are mandated by the Swiss Government to supply their data into a single Open Data Platform. DB just feeds Hafas this convenient and open set of data. Same for Apple & Google

item.title: #en @ 1513412606614196227
item.description: It's Monday, here comes my unpopular opinion. We need #OpenScience, we need #OpenData, we need to reform research and its assessment. Do we need yet another Nature editorial or piece or whatever to tell us that? I don't think so.
